#summary Description of the behaviour of OpenCL kernel argument types

= Mapping OpenCL C types to JavaCL =

Here are the different kinds of values accepted as kernel arguments in [http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/sites/javacl/apidocs/com/nativelibs4java/opencl/CLKernel.html#setArgs(java.lang.Object...) CLKernel.setArgs]

== [http://www.khronos.org/opencl/sdk/1.0/docs/man/xhtml/scalarDataTypes.html Scalar data types] ==
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type ||
|| int/uint || int ||
|| long/ulong || long ||
|| short/ushort || short ||
|| char/uchar || byte ||
|| float || float ||
|| double || double ||
|| size_t || NativeSize ||

== [http://www.khronos.org/opencl/sdk/1.0/docs/man/xhtml/vectorDataTypes.html Vector data types] ==
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type ||
|| int2, int3, int4, int8... || int[] ||

== Array/Buffer types (including arrays of vector types) ==
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type ||
|| __global int`*`<br/>__global uint`*`<br/>__global int2`*`<br/>... || CLIntBuffer (CLBuffer`<`IntBuffer`>`) ||
|| __global long`*` || CLLongBuffer ||
|| __global short`*` || CLShortBuffer ||
|| __global char`*` || CLByteBuffer ||
|| __global float`*` || CLFloatBuffer ||
|| __global double`*` || CLDoubleBuffer ||

== Image-related types ==
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type ||
|| [http://www.khronos.org/opencl/sdk/1.0/docs/man/xhtml/sampler_t.html sampler_t] || [http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/sites/javacl/apidocs/com/nativelibs4java/opencl/CLSampler.html CLSampler] ||
|| image2d_t || [http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/sites/javacl/apidocs/com/nativelibs4java/opencl/CLImage2D.html CLImage2D] ||
|| image3d_t || [http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/sites/javacl/apidocs/com/nativelibs4java/opencl/CLImage3D.html CLImage3D] ||
